column1: Sulindac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID).
Sulindac is also sold under the brand name Clinoril.

Lungs: - Slow, labored breathing - rapid breathing (hyperventilation) - Wheezing Eyes, ears, nose, and throat: - Ringing in the ears - Blurred vision - Sensitivity to light Skin: - Rash Stomach and intestines: - Diarrhea - Heartburn - Nausea - Stomach or abdominal pain - Vomiting, sometimes bloody Heart and blood: - Low blood pressure (shock) and weakness Nervous system: - Agitation - Coma - Confusion - Convulsions - Dizziness - Drowsiness - Headache (severe) - Incoherence (not understandable) - Movement disorder - Unsteadiness Other: - Chills

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation),and ventilator (breathing machine) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through the vein (intravenous or IV) - Laxative - Medicines to treat symptoms In the rare, more serious case, additional treatment may be needed.
Recovery is likely without complications, except in very large overdoses.
